name: Dinner Tonight: Cod with Tarragon-Anchovy Breadcrumbs
description: [Photograph: Blake Royer] The recipe, from Nigel Slater, sounded like a fancy version of fish and chips: Fat, meaty fillets of haddock are coated in bread crumbs and shallow-fried until brown and crisp. I substituted cod, but what intrigued me...
recipeIngredient: 2 fillets cod or haddock, about 3/4 pound
Peanut or canola oil for frying

recipeInstructions.text: Spread the flour and the egg separately on two plates large enough to hold the fillets.

Heat 1/2 inch of oil in a skillet just large enough to hold the fish. As it warms, add the butter. Dip the fish fillets in the egg, then the flour, then the breadcrumbs. If necessary, lay the fish out and pat the breadcrumbs onto the fillets by hand. Lower them carefully into the oi, which should have a healthy sizzle, cooking 3-4 minutes per side until golden brown.
Drain on paper towels briefly, and serve with lemon wedges and a simple salad.
